prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout** The final shape is a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. The cutout is located on the top face of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The triangular cutout measures 0.5 units in length and 0.25 units in height. The prism is centered in the image. 1. Create a new coordinate system. For this part, set the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2, 0.0] 2. Draw the 2D sketch for the rectangular prism and the cutout on the XY-plane of the coordinate system. The 2D sketch should be a single face (face_1) with the following loop (loop_1): 2a. Draw line_1, connecting the points [0.0, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.0]. 2b. Draw line_2, connecting the points [0.75, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.5]. 2c. Draw line_3, connecting the points [0.75, 0.5] and [0.0, 0.5]. 2d. Draw line_4, connecting the points [0.0, 0.5] and [0.0, 0.0]. Each loop should be closed. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system information (Euler angles and translation vector). 5. Extrude the 3D model using an extrusion depth toward the normal (positive Z-axis) of 0.0035 and an extrusion depth against the normal (negative Z-axis) of 0.0. This will make the height of the prism 0.5 units (from the z-coordinate of -0.2 to 0.15 rounded up). The instructions above should guide the junior CAD designer to create the first part, following the given CAD Assembly JSON while providing clear and concise instructions without using specific boolean operation terms. The information about the shape, height, width, and length of the intermediate part is also included in the text.</description>
